context/0: You would die.
context/2: We are an island in the jungle.
context/5: No stockade.
context/7: A word to you about escape.
context/8: But if you do not work hard you will be punished.
context/9: If you work hard, you will be treated well.

context: Good show.
response: Jolly good fun.
context/0: Good hunting.
context/2: It's worth it for the train.
context/3: If we set a faster pace, we could make it before sundown on the 12th.
context/4: Yai says we're two to three days' march from the Kwai.
context/5: Can we get there in time, sir?
context/8: Have fun." That's all, sir.

context: To ask me this?
response: Well, frankly, yes.
context/0: That's why you brought me here?
context/1: We'd love to have you with us.
context/2: Under the circumstances it's a bit much but you have a unique knowledge for our purpose.
context/4: How would you feel about going back?
context/5: Well, there is only one question, actually.
context/8: I don't want to be rude, but I've got a date at 2.

context: Not the way they're doing it.
response: It's utter chaos, as you can see.
context/0: Hughes, if this were your bridge, how would you use the men?
context/1: Then we'd have solid bedrock on both banks.
context/2: Further downstream, sir, across those narrows.
context/4: Our chaps could drive those logs till doomsday and they wouldn't hold.
context/5: They're sinking.
context/8: As I was trying to tell you, sir... thejapanese couldn't have picked a worse location.

context: That kind of guts.
response: Also the kind they had in 1914 when officers fought with only a swagger stick.
context/0: How's that, sir?
context/1: "Into the valley of death rode the 600."
context/2: He's got guts.
context/3: I'll say this for the old man.
context/4: You see, Jennings, there are advantages to being on the sick list.
context/5: Murdering unarmed men?
context/7: Most of those men can't walk.
context/8: You can't call it a mass escape.

context: I think we better have a look around before that train comes across.
response: He's gone mad.
context/0: Colonel, there's something rather odd going on.
context/2: River's gone down in the night.
context/4: As you once said, sir, I've got a lot to learn about the army.
context/5: Honestly, sometimes I don't understand you at all.
context/7: I'd rather not be a part of it.
context/8: It's hard to explain, sir.

context: Your knowledge of the area, making friends in that village.
response: It's almost as if your whole escape had been planned with us in mind.
context/0: You don't realise what a plum you are for us.
context/2: Well, feel like a sniff of air?
context/4: All right, Chapman, you can run along.
context/5: I'll pop over and check right away.
context/6: Arrange some practice jumps for him.
context/8: Well, maybe
context/9: Silly, it never occurred to me.

context: And no more tricks.
response: Or else I might have to raise the price on you.
context/0: Okay.
context/2: Yes.
context/3: Do you hear me, Mrs. Brenner?
context/5: Okay then, I'll be around for the money later this afternoon.
context/7: And you won't stand a chance.
context/8: If I have to go into court, that cop will tell everything he heard today.
context/9: You really got yourself into trouble now.

context: I need his help to organize my papers.
response: Then, we will leave.
context/0: Not yet, Eduardo.
context/2: In two or three days.
context/5: Eduardo, why don't we leave the country and forget this.
context/8: That's not good news.

context: Well, what did you find?
response: Sir, we ran across a band of Cheyenne off the reservation.
context/0: Thank you, Captain.
context/2: Lieutenant.
context/5: Come in.
context/7: That old Chivington sure gonna be disappointed not to have somebody to shoot at.
context/8: Next time, obey the treaty.
context/9: In peace we return to our farms and women at Sand Creek.

context: # Pass the bucket down the line
response: # Pass the bucket down the line...
context/0: # Passing the water, darling
context/1: # We've been working all day long
context/2: # We've been working all day long
context/3: # We've been working all day long
context/5: Fast.
context/7: You've got to use their momentum.
context/8: Get over there, Martin.
context/9: That's not the way I showed you.

context: Everybody to their posts!
response: Get the Lieutenant.
context/0: Indians!
context/2: Sergeant Hannah!
context/5: Well, I hope his horse is good.
context/7: It's not good to have too many people know about a hoard of gold.

context: Hello CBS?
response: Say, what are you gonna do about me?
context/0: And still others we're furiously angry.
context/1: Is that what you call entertainment?
context/2: The whole house was in an uproar.
context/3: All the kids were screaming their heads off.
context/5: A fine trick the play on people.
context/8: Se how the others was takin' it.
context/9: Sure me and the old woman was runnin' down the streets, mingled with the crowds, but we wasn't scared ourselves, just for the kicks.

context: Some people might think I was overzealous.
response: The district attorney included?
context/0: Taking charge of an estate before there was an estate.
context/2: If he is, I've committed a crime or two.
context/5: For what?
context/8: That's just what I was thinking.
context/9: I think that concludes our business, officer.

context: Now, wait a minute, I didn't say that.
response: I didn't say that at all.
context/0: So you have made no progress then?
context/1: You can't expect us to nab the man instantly when he left no clues at all.
context/2: Now, see here, this only happened the night before last.
context/3: No, I'm afraid the public won't accept that in this case, Sergeant.
context/4: To report at an early date.
context/5: However, you may say that we expect to have something definite...
context/6: What we might know and what we're able to tell you are two different things.
context/7: You've made no progress so far.
context/8: So you better produce some results, eh, Sergeant.
